titleStmt.title: Robert Earle of Essex, his Excellencie, Generall of ye Army imployed for the defence of the Protestants religion, the safety of his Ma[ies]ties person, and of the Parliament; the preseruation of the lawes, liberties, and peace of the kingdome, and protection of his Ma[ies]ties subiects from violence and oppression

Robert Earle of Essex, his Excellencie, Generall of ye Army imployed for the defence of the Protestants religion, the safety of his Ma[ies]ties person, and of the Parliament; the preseruation of the lawes, liberties, and peace of the kingdome, and protection of his Ma[ies]ties subiects from violence and oppression
titleStmt.author: Glover, George, b. ca. 1618, engraver.

notesStmt.note: An engraved portrait of the Earl of Essex by George Glover.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
